name: Baclofen
summary: A GABA-B receptor agonist primarily used for spasticity but also studied and used off-label for alcohol use disorder, anxiety, and other psychiatric conditions.
description: Baclofen is a centrally acting skeletal muscle relaxant that works as a GABA-B receptor agonist. While it is FDA-approved for spasticity due to multiple sclerosis or spinal cord injury, it has been increasingly used off-label in psychiatry, particularly for alcohol use disorder and, in some cases, anxiety disorders. Baclofen may reduce craving and anxiety through modulation of GABAergic neurotransmission. It is generally well tolerated but can cause sedation and dizziness, especially during titration.

off_label_uses: GERD (as a lower esophageal sphincter relaxant)

sections.text: Acts as an agonist at GABA-B receptors, leading to hyperpolarization of neurons and decreased excitatory neurotransmitter release.

adult.titrate: Increase by 5 mg/dose every 3 days as tolerated

sections.geriatric: Use lower initial doses and slower titration
sections.renal_impairment: Reduce dose in moderate/severe impairment; avoid abrupt withdrawal

items: Intrathecal solution: various concentrations for pump administration

sections.text: Oral onset within hours for muscle relaxation; psychiatric benefits in alcohol use disorder may take weeks.

other: Abrupt withdrawal can cause severe symptoms including hallucinations, seizures, and delirium

sections.pregnancy: Use if benefits outweigh risks; limited human data
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; monitor infant for sedation
sections.pediatrics: Not well established for psychiatric uses; intrathecal use approved for severe spasticity
sections.geriatrics: Greater risk of sedation and falls; use lower doses

sections.text: Taper gradually over 1–2 weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

items: In alcohol use disorder, higher doses (up to 180 mg/day) have been used in research but require close monitoring.
Some evidence for benefit in refractory anxiety disorders.
Abrupt discontinuation can cause severe withdrawal symptoms.
